content.text: Eduversal schools are committed to providing an inclusive education where every student, regardless of their background, ability, or language proficiency, feels valued and supported to reach their full potential.

subsections.title: The Graduated Response (Three Waves of Support)

content.text: We utilize a tiered approach to support, ensuring resources are matched to student needs.

items.title: Wave 1: Quality First Teaching (Universal)
points: High-quality, differentiated instruction in the mainstream classroom.
Teachers use flexible grouping and scaffolded tasks.

items.title: Wave 2: Targeted Support (Small Group)
points: For students who are not making expected progress despite Wave 1 support.
Time-bound interventions (e.g., reading groups, math booster sessions).
Monitored by subject teachers and Learning Support staff.

items.title: Wave 3: Specialist Support (Individual)
points: For students with significant or complex needs.
May involve external specialists (e.g., educational psychologists, speech therapists).

content.text: Given the international nature of our curriculum, EAL support is critical. Our goal is to help students access the curriculum in English while valuing their home languages.

items: Initial Assessment: All new students are assessed using WIDA or Cambridge placement tests.
Support Models: Push-in support (co-teaching) and Pull-out (intensive English) depending on proficiency level.
Exit Criteria: Clear benchmarks for students to transition out of intensive EAL support.

content.text: We support students with a range of learning needs through identification, planning, and review.

content.title: Individualized Education Plans (IEPs)
content.text: Students at Wave 3 (and some at Wave 2) will have an IEP detailing:

items: Strategies and accommodations to be used in class.

content.text: Inclusion also means challenging our most able students.

items: Identification: Through assessment data (EASE, Checkpoint) and teacher nomination.
Provision: Enrichment activities, extension tasks within lessons, and opportunities for acceleration (e.g., EduOS olympiad program).

content.title: Key Roles
rows: Primary responsibility for the progress of all students in their class; implementing differentiation.
Managing the SEN register, coordinating interventions, supporting teachers, liaising with parents.
Supporting social-emotional wellbeing, providing pastoral care.
Partners in the process; providing insights and supporting learning at home.
